basic.description: This course teaches future orientation and mobility specialists unique and creative strategies for teaching the alternate skills that are necessary for individuals who are blind and have additional disabilities to be safe, efficient travelers. The course also emphasizes how to apply critical thinking and problem solving to conditions not covered specifically in this course that may arise in one's practice as a professional in the field of visual impairment.
basic.subject: EVI
basic.title: Teaching Orientation and Mobility to Individuals with Unique Health Considerations

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisites: EVI 4220, EVI 5221, and EVI 5226. Corequisite: EVI 5222.
